messages.title: For the many, not the few
messages.content:
A decade of cuts has damaged our economy, our communities and our public services. Labour stands for the real change Britain needs.

The Brexit Party has stood down locally to give the Conservatives a free run. We must come together to enhance public services and stop Boris Johnson's hard Brexit. Vote Labour Thursday 12 December.

messages.title: Vote for Hope
messages.content:
A decade of cuts has damaged our economy, our communities and our public services. Whether it's fighting to end the public sector pay cap, or lowering the voting age to 16: Labour is always fighting to make for a fair and equal society.

Labour will give people control, putting privatised utilities into public ownership. People had water companies and energy owned managed for profits, Labour will keep them public.

You can trust Labour with our NHS - our universal healthcare on the basis of need not ability to pay. We will not let Donald Trump get his hands on it.

If you want to live in a society which works for everyone, if you want to save our hospitals, schools and public services, if you want an economy that works for all not just the privileged few; if you want to put an end to climate disasters and air pollution, vote for real change and reinvest our Environment. Vote Labour Thursday 12 December.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Stop Brexit and Remain in the EU
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I’m always campaign to Remain because remaining in the EU is the best deal for Putney, Roehampton and Southfields and the country.
Implement a Green New Deal that cuts our emissions by 2030 and create a wave of new green jobs.
End the privatisation of our NHS and address staffing shortages and waiting times.
A massive build of affordable homes and a better deal for renters.
Invest in fully funded National Youth Services and reverse the rise of number of police on our streets.
